meanings.definition: To make something slimy or slippery.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys sliming her hands with gooey slime.
meanings.sent2: The snail was sliming its way across the wet pavement.
meanings.sent3: The kids had a sliming contest using slippery slime.
meanings.sent4: The eel seemed to be sliming through the water effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The chef's secret to a perfect sauce is sliming it with butter.

meanings.definition: The act of applying a slimy substance to something.
meanings.sent1: The sliming of the cake with frosting was messy but fun.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the effects of sliming on different surfaces.
meanings.sent3: The prankster pulled a hilarious sliming prank on his friend.
meanings.sent4: The artist's masterpiece included a unique sliming technique.
meanings.sent5: The spa treatment involved a relaxing session of sliming the skin with algae.

meanings.definition: The process of removing slime or slimy substances.
meanings.sent1: The sliming of the pond was necessary to keep the water clean.
meanings.sent2: The cleaning crew was tasked with the sliming of the factory floor.
meanings.sent3: The sliming of the bathtub after a bubble bath can be a chore.
meanings.sent4: The sliming of the pipes prevented clogs in the plumbing system.
meanings.sent5: The gardeners used a special tool for the sliming of the garden paths.
